Korean: 그치 맞지, 지금 겜하다 낮잠 때리는 중 나보다 기상도 일찍 함;
English: Yeah, right, he's taking a nap while playing a game right now and he wakes up earlier than me;

Korean: 키키 아 근데 부작용으로 잠 많이 한다고 하더라!
English: Kiki, but I heard that the side effect is that you sleep a lot!

Korean: 아헐 그래? 난 큰일이네 안 그래도 많이 자는디쓰
English: Oh really? I'm in big trouble. I sleep a lot anyway.

Korean: 키키 내 친구 이틀 꼬박 잤대 키키
English: Kiki my friend slept for two whole days Kiki
Kiki and really?

Korean: 신생아 마냥 잠만 잤네 ㅜㅜ 맞으면 힘들더라
English: I just slept like a newborn ㅜㅜ It would be hard if I got hit

Korean: 맞아 그동안 밀린 잠 다 몰아서 잔 거 같다더라!
English: That's right! I think I slept through all the sleep I had lost!
Oh my, you had a hard time, but you must be relieved now that you're out of it!

Korean: 키키 그러니까 그러고 월요병 생겨서 죽겠다더라
English: Kiki: That's why I got Monday blues and thought I was going to die.

Korean: 키키 아 이런~ 월요병은 불치병이지~ 에궁
English: Kiki Oh no~ Monday blues are incurable~ Egung

Korean: 너는 남친 일주일에 몇 번 만나?
English: How many times a week do you meet your boyfriend?
I go there twice a week?
Or once a week?

Korean: 키키 그러면 주말에 자주 만나는 거네?
English: Kiki: So you meet often on weekends?

Korean: 어어 맞아 평일엔 내가 체쓰라 집에서 자야 해
English: Oh, that's right. On weekdays, I have to sleep at Chethra's house.
Kiki: Then are you still together?

Korean: 웅 맞아 같이 있어 인강 들어야 하는데 보고 싶어서 그냥 불렀어
English: Yeah, that's right. I have to go to class with you, but I just called you because I wanted to see you.
Kiki, your boyfriend also lives in Jochiwon?

Korean: 아니 남친은 대전에 살어~ 걍 불러~
English: No, my boyfriend lives in Daejeon~ Just call him~
Oh, Jochiwon and Daejeon were close?
Yeah, an hour by car? Kiki
The train is closer Kiki
That's right, your house is right next to the subway station. I'm jealous.

Korean: 마저 기차타고 대전 30분이면 가는디, 차는 한시간,
English: It takes 30 minutes to get to Daejeon by train, but an hour by car.
Right, is your boyfriend's house also near the subway station?

Korean: 아니 역세권은 아니구 그냥 좀 가까운 정도?
English: No, it's not near the station, it's just a little bit close?
Kiki, then I guess I should go to you~
Oh, but I'm going to take the last train~~

Korean: 너네는 뚱이 동생 데리고 올 생각 없어?
English: Aren't you guys planning on bringing your fat brother?

Korean: 웅 뚱이 질투의 화신이라 절대 금지
English: Yeah, that's absolutely forbidden because it's the embodiment of jealousy.
Oh my gosh Kiki is the same too
Kiki, even cats get jealous!

Korean: 근데 우리 모모 살았을 때 기억 나?
English: But do you remember when we lived together?
Was Momo also very jealous?

Korean: 아니 모모가 오복이 똥 오줌 다 가려줬어!
English: No, Momo covered all of Obok's poop and pee!

Korean: 아 헐 ㅜㅜ 모모 넘 착해 천사견 ㅜㅜ
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Momo is so kind, she's an angel dog ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그러면 오복이 이 기집애도 베풀어야 하는 거 아니냐?
English: Then shouldn't Oh Bok give this girl some too?

Korean: 키키 그치 오복이가 받을 줄 만 아네 역시 귀여운 걸 알어
English: Kiki, you know Obokki will receive it, you know she's cute

Korean: 그러니까 모모 있을 때도 엄청 모모 괴롭히고!
English: So, even when Momo was around, he bullied her a lot!

Korean: 아 이런 ㅜㅜ 모모 넘 착한 오빠였네, 오복 본 받거라
English: Oh my ㅜㅜ Momo was such a kind older brother, you should learn from Oh Bok

Korean: 맞아ㅜㅜ 오복이는 새끼 강아지만 봐도 꼬리가 너구리 꼬리 됨!
English: That's rightㅜㅜ Just looking at a puppy makes Oh Bok-yi's tail turn into a raccoon tail!

Korean: 키키 맙소사 강아지와 고양이는 아무리 천적이라지만 모모랑 컷으면서 넘 하네!
English: Kiki Oh my goodness, even though dogs and cats are natural enemies, they still do a great job with Momo!

Korean: 맞아! 태생부터 싸가지가 애가 가 없음!
English: That's right! He's a brat from birth!

Korean: 키키 역시~! 고양이는 싸가지 없는 도도함이 매력이지
English: Kiki too~! The charm of cats is their arrogance and pride.

Korean: 너네 남친분은 요즘에 하는 운동 없어?
English: Does your boyfriend do any exercise these days?
Oh, my boyfriend goes to the gym!
Oh, you quit health PT too?
No no, just use the gym!

Korean: 그러면 헬스 기구는 다 사용할 줄 아신대?
English: So you know how to use all the exercise equipment?

Korean: 음 차차 배워가고 있는 중 아닐까?
English: Well, aren't you gradually learning?

Korean: 그냥 이용권만 끊었는데 하는 법을 알려주나?
English: I just bought a ticket, can you tell me how to use it?
Wouldn't someone like the director tell us?
As you pass by?

Korean: 그렇구나 키키 지금 다닌 지 얼마나 됐대?
English: Oh, Kiki, how long has it been since you came here?
It's been a week since you left, Kiki!
Kiki, you're totally hellish!
Are you going to hell?

Korean: 키키 헬린이 키키 아니아니 그냥 살 조금 빼려는 정도임
English: Kiki Hellin is not Kiki, she's just trying to lose some weight
Oh really?
Your boyfriend is really skinny, isn't he?
Oh, it's all dried up, but my stomach is sticking out
Hey, do you like alcohol?

Korean: 술도 그렇게 많이 안 먹음 ㅜㅜ
English: I don't drink that much either ㅜㅜ

Korean: 너 나랑 통화 끝나고 무슨 게임 할 거야?
English: What game are you going to play after you finish talking to me?
I'm playing a mobile game called Grand Chase
Wow, is that thing still alive?

Korean: 아 그체 피씨도 이번에 새로 오픈 했음!
English: Ah, that PC also recently opened!
Oh really?
Is that a game about fighting monsters?

Korean: 어어 몬스터도 잡고 사람이랑 대전도 할 수 있는거
English: Oh, you can catch monsters and fight people too.
Oh really?
What level are you?

Korean: 아 모바일만 하는데 한지 얼마 안대서 110좀 넘나?
English: Ah, I only play on mobile, but it hasn't been that long since I started, so it's probably over 110?
It hasn't been that long and it's already 110?

Korean: 키키 모바일이라 좀 빨리 오르는 듯?
English: It seems like it'll go up a bit faster since it's Kiki Mobile?

Korean: 너 현질 같은 거는 안 해?
English: Don't you do anything like that?

Korean: 어어 만원정두 했어 하하 저과금 하하
English: Oh my, I paid 10,000 won haha I paid too much haha

Korean: 키키 달에 만 원씩 투자하는 거?
English: Kiki, investing ten thousand won every month?

Korean: 키키 아니 달에 만원도 안 해 그냥 가~끔 맘이 급할 때 소액
English: Kiki, no, not even ten thousand won a month, just a small amount sometimes when I'm in a hurry

Korean: 그래 그 정도는 할 수 있지!
English: Yeah, I can do that much!
Yeah, yeah, I haven't even spent 30,000 won yet.

Korean: 너의 버킷리스트 중에 가고 싶은 해외여행지 있니?
English: Is there an overseas travel destination on your bucket list?

Korean: 나는 이집트나 아이슬란드 둘 중 한 군데 가구 싶엉
English: I would like to go to either Egypt or Iceland.
Do you know a YouTuber named Bokyeom?
Bokyeom?

Korean: 아니 잘 몰라 보하 하는 애인가
English: No, I don't know, is he a guy who looks like Boha?
Don't you know the YouTuber Boyru, the first president?
Oh, the kid who's doing boyru?
I only knew it for a little while when I was watching Boyru

Korean: 키키 그 사람이 지금 이집트 여행 중임!
English: Kiki, that guy is traveling in Egypt right now!

Korean: 헐 부럽다 ㅡㅡ 이집트 피라미드 스핑크스 보고 싶다
English: Wow, I'm jealous - I want to see the Egyptian pyramids and sphinx

Korean: 와 그 피라미드 다녀온 영상 봤는데 진짜 크더라
English: Wow, I saw a video of the visit to that pyramid, and it was really big.

Korean: 아 긍게 ㅜㅜ 이집트에 피자헛 있는데 피라미드 뷰가 있대
English: Oh my goodness ㅜㅜ There's a Pizza Hut in Egypt that has a view of the pyramids

Korean: 오 맞아 키키  근데 맛은 별로래 키키
English: Oh right Kiki but it doesn't taste that good Kiki
Kiki, really?

Korean: 역시 이집트라 맛의 한계는 어쩔 수 없군
English: As expected, there is no way to avoid the limitations of taste in Egypt.
Kiki recommends the camel ride in Egypt!

Korean: 헐 잼겠다 낙타 등은 지방으로 이루어져 있지
English: Wow, that would be fun. A camel's back is made of fat.

Korean: 그 낙타도 종류가 두 종류가 있대!
English: They say there are two types of camels!

Korean: 할 그런 걸 어떻게 알았댜 키키 지니어스
English: How did you know to do that Kiki Genius
Do you like rainy days?

Korean: 웅 나는 비 오는 거 좋아해 습한 거 좋아
English: Yeah I like it raining I like it humid

Korean: 키키 어엇, 습하면 곰팡이 많이 슬잖아
English: Kiki, if it's humid, it'll get moldy.

Korean: 어어 그건 싫은데 피부가 촉촉해서 좋아
English: Oh, I don't like that, but I like it because it moisturizes my skin.

Korean: 키키 개웃기 내가 지금 촉촉한 이유가 습기 때문인가?
English: Kiki's Laughing Is it because of the humidity that I'm so wet right now?
Kiki, is that so?
It's humid today?!
The sun is shining brightly
I don't know, but I won't wash it anyway
Kiki, it looks like it's just oil; wash it off a bit

Korean: 키키 그런 듯 지금 얼굴이 반질반질함 키키
English: Kiki, it seems like your face is shiny now Kiki

Korean: 키키 오우 피부 살려주세요 ㅜㅜ 피부가 장마구만
English: Kiki Oh please save my skin ㅜㅜ My skin is like a rainy season

Korean: 키키  맞아 키키 나는 근데 적당히 오는 비가 좋아
English: Kiki, that's right Kiki, but I like moderate rain

Korean: 헐 나는 이왕 내릴거면 콰르르릉 내리는게 시원해
English: Wow, if I'm going to get off, I'd rather get off with a bang

Korean: 안 돼ㅜㅜ 비 너무 많이 와도 우리 집 밭에 있는 작물 다 망해 ㅜ
English: Noㅜㅜ If it rains too much, all the crops in my garden will be ruinedㅜ

Korean: 아아 농수산물 하는 분들은 힘들지 그치 ㅜㅜ 내 생각만 햇다
English: Ah, people who do agriculture and fisheries products must have a hard time, right? ㅜㅜ I was just thinking about myself

Korean: 키키 이번에 비 많이 와서 배추 다 무를 듯 ㅜ
English: Kiki, it rained a lot this time so I think all the cabbages will die ㅜ

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 이래서 하우스 재배가 좋은 건가
English: Wow ㅜㅜ Is this why greenhouse farming is good?

Korean: 이야, 대박 삼성 상속세 그렇게 얘기 많이 나오더니 결국에 터졌구나,
English: Wow, there was so much talk about Samsung's inheritance tax, and it finally came to light.

Korean: 아아 맞아 엄청 떼가던데 어떻게 터졌어?
English: Oh, that's right. It was really expensive. How did it explode?

Korean: 이건희 회장 죽고 재산 지금 상속 됐잖아!
English: Chairman Lee Kun-hee is dead and his assets have been inherited!
Yeah, the inheritance tax is 40%?
It was so high
Right, how much do you think the inheritance tax will be?
Oh, I see, how many trillion did you do?
Right, 1.4 trillion, is this true?

Korean: 와 진심 당장 삼성 팔아야 하는 거 아님?
English: Wow, seriously, shouldn't we sell Samsung right now?

Korean: 어, 그래서 삼성 매물 나온다고 지금 기사 장난 아니야!
English: Oh, so the article saying that Samsung is up for sale is no joke!

Korean: 아 헐 ㅜㅜ 걔네 막 그림 같은 것도 기부하고 그랫던데 상속세 깎을라구
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ They donate things like paintings and such to reduce inheritance tax.
Hehehe, so the amount you cut is 1.4 trillion?

Korean: 와 대단하다 왜케 많이 떼가는 거야? 이런~
English: Wow, that's amazing. Why are you taking so much? This is so~

Korean: 그러니까 ㅜㅜ 정부 완전 날강도 아님!?
English: So ㅜㅜ isn't the government a total robber!?

Korean: 그니까 불로소득은 우리나라가 하고 있는 듯,
English: So it seems like our country is making unearned income.

Korean: 우리나라 사람들이 내가 낸 세금 제대로 안 쓰이고 있다라는 설문 조사에 50% 이상이 맞다고 대답했대!
English: In a survey conducted in our country, more than 50% of people answered that it is true that the taxes they pay are not being used properly!

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 하긴, 투명하게 공개해주면 참 좋을텐데~ 세금 넘 많이 떼영
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Well, it would be great if they disclosed it transparently~ They take too much tax
Do you know about digital tax?
Digital tax?
What is that again?

Korean: 나도 몰랐는데 우리나라랑 비슷하게 다른 나라에서도 이 세금을 도입하자고 했대!
English: I didn't know, but other countries are also proposing to introduce this tax similar to ours!
Wow, in the whole world,?

Korean: 머 아이티 관련 세금 떼는 건가?
English: Are you deducting taxes related to Haiti?

Korean: 예를 들면 우리 웨이브 같은 거 정액제로 보잖아!
English: For example, we see things like our Wave as a flat rate!

Korean: 어어 디지털 정보 주고받는데 국가에서 세금 받겟다는거?
English: Hey, are you saying the government will collect taxes for exchanging digital information?

Korean: 맞아 결국에는 우리가 내는 세금인 거지 ㅜ
English: That's right, in the end it's our taxes that we pay.

Korean: ㄷ ㄷ 에바다 가지가지한다 뭐 하나 줄여주던가
English: ㄷ ㄷ Evada, there are so many different things, can you please reduce one of them?

Korean: 그러니까 지금 몇 프로를 뗄지 이슈래!
English: So the issue now is how much percentage to take!

Korean: ㅡㅡ 아무리 4차 산업혁명시대 디지털 시대라지만, 기본적인 것에 대해 세금을 뗀다니!
English: ㅡㅡ Even though it is the digital age of the 4th industrial revolution, they are charging taxes on basic things!

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 이것도 어마어마하게 떼일 듯 ㅜ
English: Yeah ㅜㅜ This also seems like it'll be really hard to take off ㅜ

Korean: 극혐 집이나 주고 세금 떼세요 ㅜㅜ
English: Just give me a disgusting house and deduct taxes from it ㅜㅜ

Korean: 키키 아 인정 ㅜㅜ 이거 도입되면 우리 정액제 금액 또 올라가겠지?
English: Kiki Ah, I admit it ㅜㅜ If this is introduced, our flat rate will go up again, right?

Korean: 아아 헐 ㅜㅜ 이제 노래도 맘대로 못 듣는 시대인가 이게 무슨 4차 산업혁명시대람
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Is this the era where I can't even listen to music freely? What kind of 4th industrial revolution is this?
Taxes are being taken away in a revolutionary way ㅜ

Korean: 키키 그러게 혁명이네 세금 떼는 방법이
English: Kiki, that's a revolution, that's how you collect taxes.

Korean: 너 내가 보여준 속눈썹 연장 화장품 봤어?
English: Did you see the eyelash extension makeup I showed you?

Korean: 어어 봣어 가격도 저렴하고 후기도 좋더라
English: Oh, wow, the price is cheap and the reviews are good

Korean: 그치? 그거 진짜 에뛰드 히트상품 일 거 같아!
English: Right? That looks like it'll be a real Etude hit!

Korean: 헐 글쿠나 나도 눈 다 나으면 꼭 사서 발라봐야겟어
English: Wow, I really need to buy it and try it when my eyes get better.
Are your eyes feeling bad right now?

Korean: 아아 나 지금 눈 밑에 수술한 거 아직 가끔 붉어지거든
English: Oh, I just had surgery on my under eye area, and it still gets red sometimes.

Korean: 아아 지금 수술한 지 꽤 됐지 않아?
English: Oh, hasn't it been quite some time since you had the surgery?

Korean: 웅웅 한 달 넘었지 근데 살성이 안 좋은가 봐~
English: Yeah, it's been over a month, but I guess I'm not feeling well~
Recovery is really taking a bit longerㅜ

Korean: 웅 맞아 피부에 뭐 나도 요즘 나이 먹고 잘 안나아,
English: Yeah, that's right. My skin is not doing well these days as I'm getting older.

Korean: 할 ㅜㅜ 나는 살이 잘 안 빠짐 ㅜ
English: I'm going crazy ㅜㅜ I don't lose weight well ㅜ

Korean: 키키 그건 나두 살은 안 빠지고 상처는 안 낫고!
English: Kiki, I won't lose weight and my wounds won't heal!

Korean: 키키 우리 아직  20대인데 30대 되면 더 심해질 거 아니야ㅜ
English: Kiki, we're still in our 20s. It'll get worse when we hit our 30s.

Korean: 키키 대 중반부터 시작이랬어, 이제 관리 빡세게 들어가야 한다
English: Kiki started in the middle of the year, now we have to go into management more strictly

Korean: 하 우리 이제 곧 20대 후반인 거 알아,?
English: Hey, you know we're almost in our late twenties, right?
Okay, tomorrow or the day after tomorrow, I'll be seven years old, Lucky Seven^^,
What kind of surgery did you have on your eyes?

Korean: 나 밑에 속눈섭 찔림 안검내반 수술 한고양
English: I had an entropion surgery on my lower eyelid
Is that also double eyelid surgery?

Korean: 아니아니 쌍커풀 아니구 밑에 하는 거야 위가 아니구
English: No, no, it's not double eyelids, it's the bottom, not the top
Is that surgery done under anesthesia?

English: My dad runs that red ginseng store Kiki

Korean: 억 혹시 논산에서 제일 유명한 그 곳?
English: Oh, is that the most famous place in Nonsan?
Kiki, are you sure you want to come to my house?~

Korean: 키키 어었 어디더라 허허허 혹시 옆에 마트 있는 곳,?
English: Kiki, where was it? Hehe, is there a mart nearby?

Korean: 글쎄~ 어딜까~ 맞춰보게나 키키 모르면 실망이야 하하
English: Well~ Where is it~ Guess it, if you don't know Kiki you'll be disappointed haha

Korean: 키키 아니 그 있잖아~ 장군이네~ 근데 오거리에도 홍삼 집이 있어?
English: Kiki, you know, that guy~ He's the general~ But is there a red ginseng shop in Ogeori too?
Kiki right next to Jang Gun Mart

Korean: 웅 오거리 버스정류장 앞에 크게 있어!
English: Yeah, there's a big sign in front of the Ogeori bus stop!

Korean: 키키 휴우 다행이다~ 거기 명절 때 장난 아니지?
English: Kiki Phew, thank goodness~ It's no joke during the holidays there, right?

Korean: 그때가 피크지 뭐 ㅠㅠ 그땐 나도 가서 도와드려 키키
English: That's the peak time ㅠㅠ Then I'll go and help Kiki
Kiki Oh wow, that's really the moment~
I also buy a lot of red ginseng as gifts!

Korean: 그럼 우리집 와서 하나 장만 해야겠네~
English: Then I guess I'll have to come to your house and buy one~
Right Kiki, I guess I'll have to go in 3 months!

Korean: 키키 아 시간 빠르다 설날이 돌아오네 ㅠㅠ
English: Kiki, time flies! Lunar New Year is coming soon ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅝ 추석 지난지 얼마나 됐다고!
English: That's right ㅜㅝ It hasn't been that long since Chuseok!

Korean: 근데 또 설 지나면 추석은 멀게 느껴져 키키
English: But after the Lunar New Year, Chuseok feels far away Kiki

Korean: 언니는 지금 연애하고 싶은 맘 없어?
English: Sister, don't you want to date right now?

Korean: 웅 아직은 혼자가 더 편한 거 같아!
English: Yeah, I think I'm still more comfortable alone!

Korean: 언니 마지막 연애가 언제라고 했쥐? ㅜㅜ
English: When did you say your last relationship was? ㅜㅜ
It's been so long I don't even remember... (gulp...)

Korean: 안돼 ㅜㅜ 언니 혹시 장거리 연애 어떻게 생각해?
English: No ㅜㅜ Sister, what do you think about long distance relationships?

Korean: 아 장거리는 좀 힘들 거 같아 ㅠㅠ 내 친구 고생하던데 키키
English: Ah, I think long distances will be a bit difficult ㅠㅠ My friend is having a hard time, Kiki
Yeah, I've been on long distances too, it's been tough.

Korean: 웅... 장거리는 진짜 아무나 하는 거 아니야 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah... Long distance isn't something that just anyone can do ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 나도 초반에는 헤어졌었잖아 자주 못 만나서 허허
English: Yeah, we broke up in the beginning too, we didn't see each other often haha

Korean: 그래도 지금은 익숙하고 그 오빠가 최고지?
English: But now I'm used to it and he's the best, right?

Korean: 응 맞아 키키 지금은 완전 의리로 똘똘 뭉쳤지!
English: Yeah, that's right, Kiki, we're totally united in loyalty now!

Korean: 키키 그렇게 되면 거즘 가족이야 가족
English: Kiki If that's the case, then we're a family now. Family

Korean: 키키 맞아 키키 명절 선물도 꼭 서로 보내준다규~
English: Kiki, that's right, Kiki, we definitely send each other holiday gifts~
Yeah, you should get married quickly!

Korean: 으음으음~ 나는 20대를 충분히 즐기다가 갈 거야~
English: Hmmmm~ I'm going to enjoy my 20s to the fullest~
Oh my gosh, I'll be waiting for you in your 30s Kiki

Korean: 언니네 애기들은 지금 몇 살인지 알아?
English: Do you know how old your children are now?

Korean: 음 그냥 예상만 하고 정확하게는 모르겠어 ㅠㅠ
English: Well, I just guessed, I don't know for sure ㅠㅠ
Oh really?
Did you bring it when you visited the grave?

Korean: 웅 애기들 컸을 때 데리고 온거야 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I brought them here when the kids were older ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그렇구나 어떻게 하다가 데리고 왔다고 했지?
English: I see. How did you come to bring him here?

Korean: 길에서 밥 좀 챙겨주다가 내가 납치했어 키키
English: I kidnapped Kiki while she was giving me some food on the road.

Korean: 오옥 키키  병원은 데리고 가 봤어?
English: Oh, have you taken Kiki to the hospital?

Korean: 웅 병원은 당연히 다녀야지 ㅠㅠ 이제 내 새낀데 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, of course I have to go to the hospital ㅠㅠ He's my baby now ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 오오 처음에 병원 데리고 갔을 때 뭐라고 해?
English: Kiki Oho, what did you say when you first took her to the hospital?

Korean: 상태는 나쁘지 않다고 키키 사람들 음식 많이 먹은 거 같다고 살 빼래 하하
English: The condition is not bad. Kiki said she ate a lot of food and lost weight. Haha

Korean: 다행이다 우리집 밥 주는 길냥이는 구내염 걸렸어 ㅜ
English: Thank goodness the stray cat that I feed has stomatitis.

Korean: 헐 ㅠㅠ 그럼 병원 엄청 다녀야겠네 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my gosh ㅠㅠ Then I guess I'll have to go to the hospital a lot ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 얘는 이를 다 뽑아야 하는 거라ㅜ
English: But this kid has to have all his teeth pulled outㅜ

Korean: 헐 이를 다 뽑으면 밥 어떻게 먹어 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, how am I supposed to eat if all my teeth are pulled out?

Korean: 고양이과는 씹는 게 아니고 삼키는 거라 괜찮대!
English: It's okay because felines swallow them, not chew them!

Korean: 앗 그래도 보기에 조콤... ㅠㅠ 불쌍행...
English: Ah, but it still looks a bit weird...ㅠㅠ Poor thing...

Korean: 언니는 요즘 즐겨보는 스포츠 경기 있어?
English: Sister, are there any sports games you enjoy watching these days?

Korean: 아니 요즘은 경기 보는 건 없어 키키
English: No, I don't watch games these days Kiki
really?
I guess women watch soccer a lot these days too?

Korean: 아 맞아 예능으로도 뭐 하는거 같더라!
English: Oh right, it seems like you're doing some variety shows too!
Kiki, really?
I don't know about that, but what is it?
The girls who hit the ball < Was this it? Kiki
Girls playing soccer!

Korean: 아 설마 개그우먼 *** 나오는 거 맞나
English: Oh, by any chance is it true that the comedian *** is appearing?
*** and *** these guys are coming out Kiki
Ahh Kiki, if it's ***, I definitely have to see it?
Sister, have you seen the exercise fat?

Korean: 그럼 그분 진짜 장난 아니더라 키키
English: Then he really wasn't a joke Kiki
Yeah, Kiki, isn't this a hit?
How many kilos did you deadlift?

Korean: 아 그건 못보고 그 뭐 총 쏘는거? 그건 봤어 키키
English: Oh, I didn't see that, but what about the gun shooting? I saw that, Kiki.

Korean: 키키 어 사격도 했었어? 그건 못 봤음!
English: Kiki, did you shoot too? I didn't see that!

Korean: 그거 진짜 쩔어 키키 그거 빨리 한번 봐바!
English: That's really dope Kiki, check it out quickly!

Korean: 키키 헐 나 복싱까지만 봤는데 봐야지!
English: Kiki Wow I only watched boxing, I have to watch it!

Korean: 웅 그걸로 아마 뜬걸거야 꼭 찾아봐 키키
English: Yeah, that's probably why it came up. Be sure to look it up, Kiki.
Sister, do you know the hot and cold space hippopotamus?

Korean: 뜨뜨뜨뜨 게임 유튜버 아니야? 갠 들어본거 같아 키키
English: Hot hot hot isn't that a gaming YouTuber? I think I've heard of him Kiki
That's right, he's the famous Beggar!

Korean: 웅 나 개 이름은 들어본거 같은데 개 왜?
English: Yeah, I think I've heard the name Dog before, but why Dog?
I watched it on YouTube this time and it was amazing.
Are you just flying around playing games? Kiki

Korean: 아니 애들이 미션 같은 거 주는 거 알아?
English: Did you know that the kids give you missions and stuff?

Korean: 아니 그건 몰라 ㅠㅠ 게임하면서 미션을 줬다고?
English: No, I don't know about that ㅠㅠ Did they give you a mission while playing the game?

Korean: 엉엉 막 예를 들면 양궁으로 헤드샷 한 번에 별풍 100개 이런 식으로!
English: For example, with archery, you can get 100 star winds with one headshot!

Korean: 오오 근데 그거 다 성공한거야? 키키
English: Oh, but did all of that work? Kiki

Korean: 아니 할 때마다 저 별풍을 받는데 진짜 돈 많이 가져가는 거 같아서  허허
English: No, every time I do that, I get that star wind, and it seems like I really take a lot of money, haha

Korean: 아아 근데 그런걸로 돈 버는 사람들이잖아 ㅠㅠ 우리랑은 달라...
English: Ah, but those are the people who make money doing that... They're different from us...

Korean: 맞아 진짜 그사세더라 아까 영상보니까 석궁으로 헤드샷 하면 100만 원 미션? 그거더라
English: Yeah, that's really true. I saw the video earlier, and it was a 1 million won mission if you shot a head with a crossbow? That's it.
Wow, awesome. So you earned 1 million won?
Boohoo, and you know what?

Korean: 한 번 할 때마다 100만 원이라 그 이상으로,
English: It's 1 million won every time you do it, so more than that,

Korean: 대박이다... 그럼 얼마를 번 거야 ㅠㅠ 부럽다
English: Wow... Then how much did you earn? I'm jealous.

Korean: 언니는 혹시 대구 여행 가본 적 있어?
English: Sister, have you ever been to Daegu?

Korean: 아니 부산은 갔는데 대구는 안 가봤어 ㅠㅠ 너는?
English: No, I went to Busan but not Daegu ㅠㅠ What about you?

Korean: 나는 부산도 초딩 때가 마지막이고 대구도 네버!
English: The last time I went to Busan was when I was in elementary school, and never to Daegu!

Korean: 키키 왜 대구 한번 가보고 싶어서?
English: Kiki, why do you want to go to Daegu?

Korean: 엉 대구는 근데 뭐가 유명한 가?
English: Oh, but what is Daegu famous for?

Korean: 대구는 바닥에서 계란이 익는 걸로 유명하지!
English: Daegu is famous for eggs that cook on the floor!

Korean: 키키 맞아 대프리카 오우 지금도 따뜻하대
English: Kiki right, Africa oh it's still warm

Korean: 키키 웅 거긴 진짜 그렇다고 하더라 엄청 덥데 키키
English: Kiki Woong, they say it's really hot there, Kiki

Korean: 키키  맞아 내가 아는 오빠가 거기 있는데 아직도 에어컨 튼대
English: Kiki, that's right, I know an older brother there and he's still turning on the air conditioner.

Korean: 헐 지금 에어컨 틀기엔 춥지 않을까?ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, isn't it too cold to turn on the air conditioner now?ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 거기는 대프리카잖아~ 여기랑은 차원이 다르지~
English: But that's Africa~ It's on a different level from here~

Korean: 맞아 그래도 한 번쯤은 가보고 싶네 키키
English: Yeah, but I still want to go there at least once, Kiki

Korean: ㅋㅌ 키키  맞아 나랑 날짜 잡고 갈래?
English: Haha, Kiki, that's right. Do you want to make a date with me?

Korean: 오 좋아 좋아 국내라도 여행 뿌셔보자!
English: Oh, good, good. Let's go on a trip, even if it's within the country!

Korean: 오오 좋아 좋아 이번에는 언니차 끌고 고고씽~
English: Oh, good, good. This time, let's go with my sister's car~
No no no I'm going to take the train! Train~

Korean: 이번 가을에 단풍놀이 갈 생각 있음?
English: Are you thinking of going to see the fall foliage this fall?

Korean: 웅 단풍놀이 가면 좋지~ 바람 쐬고~
English: Yeah, it would be nice to go see the fall foliage~ and get some fresh air~
Kiki, that's right, I highly recommend Sejong Arboretum! I highly recommend it!

Korean: 오 거기 지금 이쁘게 잘 되있데?
English: Oh, it's looking nice there now?

Korean: 옹옹 나 작년에 갔었는데 진짜 빨개!
English: Omg I went there last year and it was really red!

Korean: 그럼 이번에 애인 생기면 가보도록 할게...
English: Then, I'll try to go next time I get a girlfriend...

Korean: 아앗, 왜 친구들이랑 갈 수 있잖아
English: Oh, why can't I go with my friends?
The kids are busy meeting their lovers...

Korean: 키키 헐 언니도 거기 꼽사리 고고
English: Kiki, oh my sister, you're also there, go go go

Korean: 키키 싫어 어차피 말도 안 해줘 둘이 꽁냥거려 ㅠㅠ
English: I hate Kiki. I won't tell you anyway. The two of you are just being affectionate. ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 하 눈물난다 거기 그리고 동물도 있음!
English: Kiki ha I'm crying there and there are animals too!
animal?
Is it like a zoo?

Korean: 음 토끼랑 사슴이랑 양이랑 이런 애들 있으
English: Well, there are rabbits, deer, sheep, and things like that.

Korean: 오 가서 그럼 양도 좀 보고 와야겠다 키키
English: Oh, I should go and look at the sheep. Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 근데 원숭이? 도 있는데 애들은 좀 불쌍해,
English: Kiki is right, but there are monkeys too? The kids are a bit pitiful,

Korean: 아 원숭이는 좀 불쌍하긴 할 거 같아 ㅠㅠ 자유 없어서 ㅠㅠ
English: Ah, I think the monkey is a bit pitiful ㅠㅠ because he has no freedom ㅠㅠ
Wow, this time Samsung Electronics' inheritance tax is a huge hit.
inheritance tax?
It's always an issue there ㅠㅠ
Yeah, wow, the inheritance tax is really huge.
There's an article saying how much is the inheritance tax?

Korean: 조, 단위더라, 진짜 상상도 못한 정체
English: Joe, it's a unit, it's a really unimaginable identity

Korean: 헐랭... 근데 그걸 낼 돈이 있다는 거잖아... 대박
English: Wow... but you have the money to pay for it... daebak

Korean: 아니 그래서 이번에 삼성쪽 기업 한나 매각한대
English: No, so this time, Samsung is selling off one of its companies.
What are you selling?
It's not heavy industry, right? ㅠㅠ
No, isn't that SDS?

Korean: 그건 무슨 회사지... 잘 안 알려진 거 없애려나 보네 ㅠㅠ
English: What company is that... I guess they're trying to get rid of something that's not well known ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아니야 삼성이면 다 유명한 곳인데 진짜 상속세가 무섭더라,
English: No, Samsung is a famous place, but the inheritance tax is really scary.

Korean: 그래도 그만큼 있으니까 나오는 거겠지 ㅠㅠ 그저 부럽다..
English: But I guess it comes out because there's that much of it ㅠㅠ I'm just jealous..

Korean: 키키 흠,  여기서 웃는 건 정부밖에 없는 듯!
English: Kiki Hmm, it looks like the only one laughing here is the government!
Haha, so this is how taxes are paid haha

Korean: 키키 맞아 키키 이걸로 우리 재난지원금 받고 있는 건가?
English: Kiki, right Kiki, are we receiving disaster relief funds with this?

Korean: 아앗... 그럼 또 할 말이 많이 없어지네 하하
English: Ahh... Then I don't have much to say haha

Korean: 언니 세금 중에 디지털세라고 알아? 키키
English: Sister, do you know about the digital tax among taxes? Kiki
Digital tax?

Korean: 그런 말은 처음 듣는 거 같은데 키키 뭐 생겼어?
English: I think it's the first time I've heard that, but what does Kiki look like?

Korean: 전세계에서 디지털세라는 세금 명목을 내기로 한 법안이 생겼댘ㅋ
English: Around the world, there are bills being passed to impose a tax called digital tax.
Then what do you mean by sticking it all on the machine?ㅡㅡ

Korean: 아니 우리 보는 넷플같은 거 있잖아!
English: No, we have something like Netflix!
Digital tax is added to the flat rate.

Korean: 아아... 난 가전제품 이런 거에 붙는다는 줄, 근데 거기에 세금 붙어 있지 않아?
English: Ah... I thought it was for things like home appliances, but isn't there a tax on those?

Korean: 근데 이제 디지털세라는 명목이 하나 더 생기는 거지!
English: But now, there is another thing called digital tax!

Korean: 와 진짜 아주 미쳤구만 ㅠㅠ 싫어... 세금 늘리지마 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, this is really crazy ㅠㅠ I hate it... Don't raise taxes ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그러니까, 디지털세, 아주 그냥 다 갖다 붙이는 거 같음!
English: So, digital tax, it seems like they're just slapping everything together!

Korean: 그냥 돈 주세요~ 이거지 뭐 ㅠㅠ 지금 세금 걷으려고 에구..
English: Just give me money~ This is it ㅠㅠ They're trying to collect taxes now, ugh..

Korean: 키키 맞아, 결국에 우리가 다 내는 거잖아!
English: Kiki: That's right, in the end we end up paying for everything!

Korean: 돈 받으면 뭐해 평생동안 더 내게 생겼는데 키키
English: What's the use of receiving money? I've got more for the rest of my life. Kiki

Korean: 키키 세금 떼이다 죽겠으~ 눈물 난다
English: Kiki, I'm dying from paying taxes~ I'm crying

Korean: 내 말이 평생 이렇게 일 노예 되는 거지 ㅠㅠ 일개미 뚠뚠...!
English: What I'm saying is that I'll be a workaholic my whole life ㅠㅠ Worker ant, chubby chubby...!

Korean: 흙 ㅜㅜ 오늘도 열심히 일을 한다!
English: Dirt ㅜㅜ I'll work hard today too!
I'll work hard tomorrow too!

Korean: 언니는 기초 화장품 뭐 쓰고 다녀?
English: Sister, what kind of basic cosmetics do you use?
I'm using Avene right now!

Korean: 오오 우리 언니도 아벤느 쓰는데 좋대!
English: Oh, my sister also uses Avene and she said it's good!
Yeah, that sounds good because it's mild!

Korean: 맞아 우리 언니도 피부 민감해서 그거 잘 써!
English: That's right, my sister has sensitive skin too, so she uses that a lot!
Um, should I say that cosmetics are soft?

Korean: 맞아 진짜 딱 봐도 순해 보여~
English: Yeah, it really looks innocent at first glance~

Korean: 순하고 부드러워서 기초 바르는데 부들부들~ 키키
English: It's so gentle and soft that I feel trembling when applying foundation~ Kiki

Korean: 키키 언니도 화장폼에 톡톡 묻혀서 써?
English: Does Kiki-sister also apply it by dabbing it on her makeup foam?
I put the skin on cotton and apply it!

Korean: 그러니까 키키 우리 언니도 그렇게 써 그거 파란 공병 맞아?
English: So Kiki, my older sister writes like that too. Is that the blue bottle?

Korean: 아 그거 에센스랑 로션 있는 거?
English: Oh, that one has essence and lotion?

Korean: 어어 맞아! 언니는 파란 공병 아니야?
English: Oh, that's right! Aren't you a blue soldier?

Korean: 웅 그거 썼다가 투명한 거 스킨만 있는 걸로 바꿨어!
English: Yeah, I used that and then changed it to something that only has transparent skin!
Oh, Kiki, did you buy that at Olyoung!?

Korean: 웅 맞아 올영 ㅠㅠ 근데 갈 때마다 품절이라 잘 보고 사야 해 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's right. It's sold out every time I go there, so I have to look carefully and buy it.

Korean: 언니는 어렸을 때부터 홍삼 먹어서 잔병이 없나벼!
English: Sister, you've been eating red ginseng since you were little, so you don't get sick!
Oh, really?

Korean: 근데 홍삼 하기 전부터 건강했어 키키
English: But I was healthy before I started taking red ginseng Kiki
Kiki, are your parents okay?
Is it the power of genetics!?

Korean: 맞아 우리집은 크게 아프거나 한 분은 없어 키키
English: Yes, no one in my family is seriously ill or anything. Kiki

Korean: 그렇구나 우리 집은 막내작은아빠가 산에서 약초 캐오셔서 그거 먹음 키키
English: That's right. In our house, the youngest uncle picks herbs from the mountain and eats them.

Korean: 와 대박 그게 바로 최고 아니야? 키키 나도 줘
English: Wow, wow, isn't that the best? Kiki, give me some too

Korean: 키키 우리는 산삼 그냥 씹어 먹쥐~
English: Kiki, we just chew on the ginseng and eat it~

Korean: 키키 대박 그냥 씹어 먹으면 안써?
English: Kiki, can't you just chew on it and eat it?
are you okay?

Korean: 키키 응 써서 꿀 찍어 먹는데 그래도 씀 키키
English: Kiki, yes, I use it and dip it in honey, but I still use it Kiki

Korean: 가끔 횟집 가면 나오는 그런 거 느낌인가 키키
English: Kiki, it feels like the kind of thing that comes out sometimes when you go to a sushi restaurant

Korean: 키키 아니야 우리는 뿌리 굵기부터가 다르쥐~
English: Kiki, no, our roots are different~
Mom?

Korean: 엄청 크고 튼튼한 거 먹는 건가 키키
English: Kiki, are you eating something really big and strong?

Korean: 키키 근데 나는 산삼이랑은 안 맞더라 몸에서 열이 너무 많이 남!
English: Kiki But I don't get along with ginseng. It makes my body heat up too much!

Korean: 키키 그래서 너 더위 타나보다 너무 많아 먹어서
English: Kiki, so you must be hot because you ate too much

Korean: 키키 맞아 그래서 요즘에는 잘 안 먹어
English: Kiki That's right, so I don't eat it much these days

Korean: 키키 나중에 생기면 그거 나한테 넘겨라~
English: Kiki, if you happen to come out later, give it to me~
Where do you buy things like clothes, sister?

Korean: 나는 그냥 지하상가 이런데 가면 막 사와 키키
English: I just go to places like underground shopping malls and buy Kiki
Oh really?
Sister, do you often go to the Daejeon underground shopping mall?

Korean: 웅 그냥 가면 사오고 그래 키키  옷에 욕심이 없어
English: Yeah, I'll just go and buy it. I don't have any greed for Kiki's clothes.

Korean: 키키 나도 키키 나는 유행타는 옷 사서 1년 입고 버려
English: Kiki Me too Kiki I buy trendy clothes and wear them for a year and throw them away

Korean: 키키 난 그냥 기본 사서 낡아지면 그때 버려 키키
English: Kiki I just buy the basic ones and throw them away when they get old. Kiki

Korean: 맞아 키키 나 이번에 바지 헐어서 지그재그에서 하나 삼
English: Yeah Kiki I'm going to wear loose pants this time so I'm going to buy one from ZigZag
Kiki Oh, that app?
Didn't you use brandy in the past?

Korean: 그냥 둘 다 번갈아 가면서 쓰는 중!
English: I'm just using both alternately!

Korean: 키키 거기 옷들이 좋게 잘 나와?
English: Kiki, do the clothes there look nice?

Korean: 음 그것도 케바케야 잘 보고 사야혀!
English: Yeah, that's also Kebakaya, you have to look carefully before buying!

Korean: 웅 진짜 재질도 중요해 이제 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, the material is really important now ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 나는 제일 중요하게 생각하는 건 쿠폰 허허
English: But what I think is most important is coupons haha

Korean: 맞아 똑같은 거 쿠폰 있는데 가서 사잖아 키키
English: Yeah, I have a coupon for the exact same thing, so I went and bought it. Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 나 이번에 쿠폰으로 15% 할인 받아서 샀음!
English: Kiki, that's right, I bought it this time with a 15% discount coupon!

Korean: 오 알뜰살뜰하게 잘 샀구먼! 잘했어 키키
English: Oh, you bought it frugally! Good job Kiki.
Sister, do you happen to know the singer **?
Yeah, I know, Twice sisters~
Kiki, that's right, I listened to the new song this time!

Korean: 아니 이번에 나온 건 못 들어봄 ㅠㅠ 노래 좋아?
English: No, I haven't heard the one that came out this time ㅠㅠ Do you like the song?
This song is just their style!

Korean: 그 달라달라 그런 느낌 노래야? 키키
English: Is that a song that feels like that? Kiki
Um, first of all, the title is Mafia!

Korean: 아 뭔가 느낌이 온다 와 키키
English: Ah, I have a feeling, Kiki

Korean: 키키 그치 키키 옷도 그 비닐 제질의 제이와이피가 좋아하는 그 옷임
English: Kiki, that's right, Kiki's clothes are also those plastic clothes that JYP likes

Korean: 키키 아놔 키키 왜 애들한테 그런 옷 입혔냐고ㅠㅠ
English: Kiki, oh my Kiki, why did you make the kids wear those clothes?ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 아니야 진짜 간지나 약간 제복같은 느낌?
English: Kiki, no, really cool. Does it feel a bit like a uniform?
Hmm, I can't imagine?
I guess I'll have to search for it Kiki

Korean: 키키 엉 이 노래 은근 중독성 있음!
English: Kiki, this song is secretly addictive!
Idol songs must be addictive!

Korean: 인정 키키 나는 노래방 18번 곡으로 이 곡을 선택했쥐
English: I admit, I chose this song as my 18th song at karaoke.
Oh, now it's song number 18? Kiki
That's great

Korean: 언니 요즘에도 짱구는 못말려 하는 거 알아?
English: Sister, did you know that even these days, Shin-chan is still unstoppable?

Korean: 웅 그거 지금 인기더라 사람들이 많이 말하던데 키키
English: Yeah, that's popular right now. People are talking about it a lot. Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 이번에 내가 페북에 떴길래 봤거든?
English: Kiki, you're right, I saw it on Facebook this time.

Korean: 웅웅 맞아 지금 엄청 돌아다닌다고 하더라!
English: Yeah, that's right. I heard they're really busy these days!

Korean: 키키 맞아 밥 먹으면서 보니까 딱 맞아
English: Kiki, that's right, I saw it while eating rice, it's exactly right

Korean: 키키 요즘 그거 보느냐고 연락이 없었구만?
English: Kiki, you haven't contacted me recently to ask if I've been watching it?

Korean: 키키 당연하쥐~ 데 내가 이번에 강아지애견사? 그편을 봤거든?
English: Kiki Of course~ But I saw the episode about the dog lover this time?
Dog therapist?
Was there something like that in Crayon Shin-chan?

Korean: 엉엉 최근에 나온 거라 언니 모르지?
English: Oh my, it came out recently, so you don't know, right?

Korean: 아아 짱구 최근건 안 봐서 몰라 ㅠㅠ
English: Ah, I don't know because I haven't watched Shinchan recently ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 이게 강아지 애견 미용하는 거 나오는데 진짜 오글거륌 ㅜ
English: Kiki, this is a video of a dog being groomed, it's really gross ㅜ
Kiki, are you ogling?
Wasn't Shin-chan funny? Kiki

Korean: 아니 최고의 애견미용사가 되기 위해서 강아지의 마음을 안다고 강아지 탈 쓰고 왈왈댐 키키
English: No, to become the best dog groomer, Kiki wears a dog costume and barks because she knows the mind of a dog.

Korean: 아놔  키키 그러고 흰둥이랑 친구하고 있는 거 아니야? 키키
English: Oh, Kiki, aren't you friends with Whitey? Kiki

Korean: 키키 하 몰라 그거 보고 바로  끔 키키
English: Kiki ha I don't know, I saw that and immediately turned it off Kiki

Korean: 키키 그거 보면서 현타 왔나보네 키키
English: Kiki, you must have gotten a stroke while watching that Kiki

Korean: 나 오늘 먹을 점심 추천 좀!
English: Can you recommend something for lunch today?
I'm craving pork soup, how about it?! Kiki
Oh, I don't like the country,
Then what do you like besides soup?~
Um~ First of all, nothing spicy!

Korean: 매운 거 말고면 나는 갈비 추천!
English: If you don't like spicy food, I recommend the ribs!
rib?
I'm eating alone ㅜ Alone?

Korean: 혼밥 레벨 낮아 갈비~ 키키 그래도 맛있잖아
English: The level of eating alone is low, but the ribs~ Kiki are still delicious

Korean: 키키 아니 나는 집에서 먹고 싶은데ㅜ
English: Kiki No, I want to eat at homeㅜ
Then can you recommend some delivery food?
Kiki Yeah, that's right, delivery~~ No packaging either
I think it's lunch time so how about mala-tang?

Korean: 음, 매운 거 말고라고 했자녀 ㅜ
English: Well, I said not spicy.

Korean: 마라탕 맵기 낮추면 안 맵고 맛있어 하하
English: If you lower the spiciness of the mala tang, it won't be spicy and will be delicious haha
No no, not the red one!
Then should we just eat at a Chinese restaurant?

Korean: 너는 자취 한 번도 안 해 봤지?
English: Have you never lived alone?

Korean: 응 키키 너는 자취 해 봤어?
English: Hey Kiki, have you ever lived alone?
I'm in Seoul right now!

Korean: 서울에서 하면 집 값 엄청 비싸겠다!
English: If you do it in Seoul, the price of housing will be incredibly expensive!

Korean: 키키 야 완전 후덜덜이야 나 깜짝 놀람 ㅜ
English: Kiki, I'm so scared, I'm so shocked ㅜ

Korean: 혹시 월세 가격 정도는 알 수 있을까?
English: Do you happen to know the approximate monthly rent price?
First of all, let's start with a really small room, room 50.

Korean: 헉 나는 그냥 서울 말고 다른 곳에서 시작해야겠네
English: Oh man, I guess I should just start somewhere other than Seoul.
Have you decided where to go?
No, I just wanted to live alone~
just?
Have you saved some money?
money?

Korean: 당연히 대출로 가야지 나 돈 없어 하하
English: Of course I should take out a loan, I don't have money haha

Korean: 야 키키 근데 어딜 나가려고 혀
English: Hey Kiki, where are you going?
I suddenly started to dream of living alone...

Korean: ㅋㅋㅋ 야 로망따위 없어,, 그딴 거 없다구 ㅜ
English: Hahaha, there's no such thing as romance, there's no such thing ㅜ

Korean: 에이 아니야 내 꿈이야 한 번 알아보려고 ㅋㅋ
English: Hey no it's my dream I'll find out lol
Do you have a driver's license?
Are you out of the military?

Korean: 당연하지 키키 군대 가기 전에 땄어
English: Of course, I got it before Kiki went to the army.
Oh, you got it faster than I thought?

Korean: 응 그냥 나이 되자마자 바로 취득~
English: Yeah, just get it as soon as you get the age~

Korean: 키키  오 운전하는 거 안 어려웠으?
English: Kiki Oh, wasn't driving difficult?
I'm totally the best driver~ haha

Korean: 오 너 한 번도 사고 안 냄?
English: Oh, you've never had an accident?
Yes, it's been 4 years but there have been no accidents yet.

Korean: 오오 너 지금 나이가 몇 살이지?
English: Oh, how old are you now?
I'm 22 now! Kiki
3rd year since I was 19?
Oh, you really got it early?

Korean: 응 나 드라이브 하는거 좋아해서 바로 땄어!
English: Yeah, I like driving so I got it right away!
Do you have a license?
Of course I'm a first class average~
Oh, it's one piece?
When did you get it?
I was the only one who didn't know, Kiki
Kiki I got it as soon as I turned 20!
Oh, I see now haha

Korean: 너 지금 다니고 있는 회사 있어?
English: Are you working for a company right now?
No, there is no company yet, job seekers...
I see. So are you working part-time now?

Korean: 응 알바 이제 알아보고 면접 보고 왔어!
English: Yeah, I just looked into part-time jobs and went for an interview!
Oh, where did you go for the interview?
It was just a convenience store part-time job, but they even interviewed me.
I see. Do they pay a lot of wages there?
Of course it's the minimum wage. Kiki gave me 8750.
Wow, how many hours do you work?
It was written 10 hours a day, 3 days a week!
Wow, 10 hours each?
Are you doing this a lot?

Korean: 지금 돈이 급해서 알바라도 열심히 해야 해...
English: I need money urgently right now, so I have to work hard even if it means working part-time...
Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Are you giving me all the holiday pay?

Korean: 에이 그럴리가 편의점 주휴수당 챙겨주는데 드물더라 키키
English: Oh, that's not possible. It's rare for convenience stores to give out holiday allowances. Kiki
Oh no, that won't do! Report it!

Korean: 근데 편의점은 그게 당연 한 거 같더라!
English: But I think that's normal for convenience stores!

Korean: 너는 군대 나온 지 몇개월 됐니?
English: How many months has it been since you left the military?

Korean: 나 지금 전역 9개월 차 예비군이지~ 하하
English: I'm currently in the reserves, 9 months out of service~ haha
Kiki Oh Reserve Army~ You're so cute~
Okay~ Now you're in your first year, Kiki

Korean: 키키 너 여친한테 꽃 신은 신겨 줌?
English: Kiki, are you going to give your girlfriend some flower shoes?
Of course I prepared shoes and cake
Oh, the cake is a lettering cake?
Yeah, Kiki, you definitely have to do it with lettering.

Korean: 오오 키키 문구는 뭘로 해 줬어
English: Oh, what did you use for the Kiki stationery?

Korean: 기억이 안 나 키키 문구가 좀 길었었거든
English: I don't remember, Kiki's phrase was a bit long

Korean: 키키 오 케이크 호수는 몇 호짜리로 했으?
English: Kiki O, what size cake did you make?

Korean: 그거 카페에서 파는 사이즈 호수로 주문했어!
English: I ordered that in the size they sell at the cafe!
Oh, you really did a good job!

Korean: 알았어~ 전역도 했으니 이제 자유다 나는~
English: Okay~ I've been discharged from the military so now I'm free~

Korean: 키키 이제 예비군 훈련 또 있지 않니?
English: Kiki, don't you have reserve force training again?
maybe?
If you just stay there, it will go away
How far did you go in school?
I have now graduated from high school!
Oh, I see. Me too. Were you in the business world?

Korean: 나는 마이스터고라고 실업계 업그레이드 버전 키키
English: I am a Meister High School student, upgraded version of Kiki
Kiki Oh, then what is a specialized high school?
That's probably what the industry has changed its name to!

Korean: 키키 아 그러면 나는 그냥 실업계네 ㅜ
English: Kiki Ah then I'm just an unemployed person ㅜ

Korean: 에이 그게 그거지 뭐 키키 대학교 안 가고 그냥 취업했어
English: Hey, that's it. Kiki didn't go to college and just got a job.

Korean: 그렇구나 지금 취업한 곳에서 일하는 중?
English: I see. Are you working at your current job?

Korean: 응 졸업하고 바로 갔어 키키 대학교 안 가려고
English: Yeah, I went right after graduating so I wouldn't have to go to Kiki University.
I see. So you must have gotten a job at a good place?
No, I just got a job at a small to mid-sized company.
Small business?
But isn't it a good company?
It's just a small business in an industrial complex~
I see. So you're still working hard?

Korean: 응 지금 열심히 매일 출근한다 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I'm working hard every day now ㅠㅠ
What is your family structure like?

Korean: 나는 부모님이랑 나 혼자 이게 끝이야 키키
English: I'm alone with my parents, this is the end Kiki

Korean: 그렇구나 부모님이 너 엄청 예뻐하실 듯!
English: I see. Your parents must really love you!

Korean: 맞아 외동이라서 더욱 아끼시는 거 같더라
English: Yes, I think he loves me even more because I'm an only child.

Korean: 키키 오우 너 부모님한테 효도 잘 해야겠다
English: Kiki Oh, you should be good to your parents.

Korean: 나 항상 효도 잘 하고 완전 든든한 아들이지!
English: I've always been a good, dutiful son!

Korean: 키키 오 진짜 그러는 거 확실해?
English: Kiki Oh, are you sure that's true?

Korean: 당연하지 키키 부모님이 나를 얼마나 좋아하시는데~
English: Of course Kiki's parents love me so much~

Korean: 키키 부모님 생신 때 꼭 미역국 너가 해 드려
English: Kiki, you always make seaweed soup for your parents' birthdays.
Seaweed soup?

Korean: 나 사실 요리 손 재주는 없는데...
English: Actually, I'm not good at cooking...

Korean: 키키 야 요즘에 레시피 잘 나와 있어서 할 수 있어
English: Kiki, these days there are so many recipes out there that I can make it.
Then, should I do it for my parents' wedding anniversary too?
Oh but I also wonder about that

Korean: 그러게 이건 어떻게 해야하지 고민이다 ㅠㅠ
English: I'm worried about what to do about this ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 나는 근데 안 챙기려고 함
English: Kiki I don't want to take it though
okay?
Then I guess I'll have to think about it a little more
How many days have you been with your girlfriend?

Korean: 나 지금 1년 훨씬 넘었을 거야 아마도?~
English: I guess it's been more than a year now?~
Oh wow, we dated longer than I thought~

Korean: 에이 아니야~ 키키 아직 애기지 뭐
English: Hey no~ Kiki is still a baby
Were you younger?
Was it an association?
Don't you remember?
I'm young and my girlfriend is older than me.

Korean: 오 여친이랑 나이 차이 몇 살 나?
English: Oh, how many years is the age difference between you and your girlfriend?
Kiki, we're two years apart. I'm two years younger than you.
Oh my gosh, my girlfriend is so talented~~
I admit that the girlfriend I have is capable~

Korean: 키키 그래 그렇게 얘기가 되는구나 여친 생일은 언제야
English: Kiki, so that's what it's like. When is your girlfriend's birthday?
It's November and it's almost here so I'm going to have to get ready!
Oh, do you have a gift in mind?

Korean: 아직 없는데 슬슬 후보도 고르고 할거야 하하
English: I don't have one yet, but I'm going to start picking candidates soon haha

Korean: 오오 뭔데 나한테만 자그맣게 얘기 해 줘 하하
English: Oh, what is it? Tell me in private, haha

Korean: 에이 아직 비밀이야 조금 있다가 알려 줄게
English: Hey, it's still a secret. I'll tell you later.
Is your kid alive and well now?
I was sick yesterday too, so I went to the hospital again...
Oh my, why didn't you say it was okay last time...

Korean: 어제 등에 털이 빠져서 땜빵이 생겼더라고 키키
English: Kiki, yesterday my back hair fell out and I got a patch

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 그거 왜 그런 거래?
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Why is that a deal?
First, I did a culture test and they said it would take a week.
Culture test?
Is there such a test?

Korean: 응 곰팡이 균 검사하는 건데 1주일 넘게 걸린다 들었어
English: Yeah, I heard it takes over a week to test for mold.
Oh, I see. You even got mold. I'm so sad.

Korean: 아직 모르지만 내가 볼 땐 맞는 거 같아
English: I don't know yet, but it looks right to me
Wow, you lost a lot of hair?
No, it was just the back that was completely missing!

Korean: 그거 갑자기 그런 거야 아니면 옛날부터 그런 거야?
English: Is that something that just happened all of a sudden or has it always been like that?

Korean: 그 심장사상충 약 바른 곳 근처에서 빠졌어
English: It fell right near where I applied the heartworm medication.

Korean: 어 심장사상충 약 때문에 그런 건 아니고?
English: Oh, it's not because of the heartworm medication?

Korean: 그렇다고는 하는데 혹시나 해서 검사도 했찌
English: That's what they say, but just in case, I did a test

Korean: 너는 요즘에 하고 있는 운동 있어?
English: Are you doing any exercise these days?

Korean: 나 오늘 축구 뛰러 갈거야 키키
English: I'm going to play soccer today Kiki
Oh really?
Do you play soccer with your friends?
No, not friends, just a club!
Oh really?
You joined the club too?

Korean: 맞아 축구 하고 싶어서 가입 했었어
English: Yeah, I signed up because I wanted to play soccer.

Korean: 오오 그러면 모르는 사람들이랑 하는 거야?
English: Oh, so you're doing it with people you don't know?

Korean: 응 모르는 사람들인데 그냥 가서 볼 차는 거지 뭐~
English: Yeah, I don't know them, but I guess I'll just go and see~

Korean: 오 역시 남자들은 그런 게 좋은 거 같어
English: Oh, I guess men like that kind of thing

Korean: 가서 친해지고 같이 밥도 먹고 얼마나 좋아!
English: It would be so nice to go and get to know each other and have a meal together!

Korean: 맞아 아 같이 밥도 먹기로 했어?
English: Right? Oh, so you decided to eat together?

Korean: 응 축구하고 술 한 잔 하기로 했지~
English: Yeah, we decided to play soccer and have a drink~
Hey, but is that possible now?

Korean: 식당 말고 그냥 벤치에서 하는 거야 키키
English: Kiki, instead of a restaurant, we just do it on a bench
Oh, I see. Are you packing a lunch?
Maybe I should buy it at a convenience store and eat it?

Korean: 너 요즘에 자주 하는 게임이 뭐야?
English: What games do you play a lot these days?

Korean: 나 요즘 배그 자주 하는 거 같아
English: I think I play bag a lot these days

Korean: 배그 너 치킨 혼자서 먹을 수 있음?
English: Bagner, can you eat chicken by yourself?

Korean: 응 나 배린이긴한데 요즘 치킨 자주 먹어
English: Yeah, I'm a vegetarian, but I eat chicken a lot these days.

Korean: 오 너 되게 잘 하나 벼?
English: Oh, you're really good at it, aren't you?

Korean: 에이 아니야 너도 옛날에 배그 했었잖아?
English: Hey, no, you used to have a bag too, right?

Korean: 나 근데 그냥 뒤에만 졸졸 따라다니기만 했어
English: But I just followed behind

Korean: 그럼 나 따라다니면서 가방 역할이나 할래? 키키
English: Then do you want to follow me around and act as my bag? Kiki

Korean: 키키  맞아 내가 애들 붕대 주고 주사주고 그럼 ㅜ
English: Kiki, that's right, I'll give the kids bandages and shots and stuff ㅜ

Korean: 아주 좋은 자세야 나한테도 그렇게 해 줘 하하
English: Very nice pose, do that to me too haha

Korean: 키키 알겠어 근데 초반에 죽으면 난 몰라 ㅜ
English: Kiki I get it but I don't know if you die in the beginning ㅜ

Korean: 초반에 잘 살아 남으면 문제 없어!
English: If you survive well in the beginning, you'll be fine!

Korean: 키키 내가 초반에 잘 살아남을 수 있을까
English: Kiki, can I survive well in the beginning?

Korean: 내 뒤에 딱 붙어있어 그러면 가능
English: If you stick right behind me, then it's possible

Korean: 키키  오 좋아 나한테 붕대랑 주사 다 넘겨줘
English: Kiki Oh okay, just give me the bandages and the injections.

Korean: 그래 키키 너는 내 가방이 되는 거야
English: Yeah Kiki, you're going to be my bag.
Are you going on a trip this time?
i envy you

Korean: 헉 맞아 키키 너무 설레 지금 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my gosh, Kiki, I'm so excited right now ㅠㅠ
Where did you decide to go with your girlfriend?
This time, I decided to go to Jeju Island for the first time.

Korean: 오오 대박 제주도 몇 박 며칠?
English: Oh wow, how many nights and days are you going to Jeju Island?
I've already made a reservation for 3 nights and 4 days~ Kiki
I'm jealous ㅜㅜ Can you get cheap plane tickets?

Korean: 응 비행기표는 인당 왕복 3만원 정도? 하하
English: Yeah, round trip plane tickets are about 30,000 won per person? Haha
Wow, they're giving it away for so cheap~
Right? Kiki

Korean: 옛날부터 예약 해 놔서 그런 거 같아
English: I think it's because I made a reservation a long time ago
Oh, when did you reserve the ticket?

Korean: 2달 전에 미리 스카이스캐너에서 예약~ 키키 부지런이 답이야
English: Booked on Skyscanner 2 months in advance~ Kiki diligence is the answer
What is Skyscanner?
What's the app name?

Korean: 응 비행기표 예매하는 앱이야 거기가 가격 싸
English: Yeah, it's an app for booking plane tickets. The prices there are cheaper.
Oh really?
I need to download that app too!

Korean: 다운 받아서 너도 미리 예약 해 놔
English: Download it and reserve it for yourself too
Where do you live now?

Korean: 나 완전 남쪽이잖아 키키 항구의 도시 부산~
English: I'm completely in the south, Kiki's port city Busan~

Korean: 키키 오 너네는 지금 날씨 어떰?
English: Kiki Oh, how's the weather like for you guys now?

Korean: 완전 지금 폭우야 키키 소리가 살벌해
English: It's pouring right now, Kiki's voice is so scary

Korean: 헐 대박 지금 비 많이  와?
English: Oh my goodness, is it raining a lot now?

Korean: 응 키키 우산이 부러지는 사람도 봤었어
English: Yeah, I saw someone's umbrella break.
Wow, wow! It's October now, isn't it the rainy season?
To that extent?

Korean: 태풍 온 건가 싶더라 바람이 너무 불어
English: I thought a typhoon was coming, the wind was blowing so hard
Wow, wow, it's sunny here?
okay?

Korean: 같은 나라인데 왜 이렇게 날씨가 다르지...
English: It's the same country, but why is the weather so different...

Korean: 그러게 너 집 밖에 나갈 일 있어?
English: So, do you have any reason to go out of the house?

Korean: 아니 없어서 다행이야 난 비 맞기 싫어 ㅠㅠ
English: No, thank goodness it's not there. I hate getting rained on ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나도 비 맞는 건 질색 ㅜ
English: I hate getting rained on too ㅜ

Korean: 그래서 나는 그냥 오늘 집에만 있을 거야
English: So I'm just going to stay home today

Korean: 그래그래 오늘 같은 날은 집콕이 최고야!
English: Yeah yeah, on a day like today, staying home is the best!

Korean: 그래 나랑 같이 그냥 집콕이나 하자
English: Yeah, let's just stay home together
Do you know the YouTuber ***?
huh?
I don't know, but I heard it somewhere...
Oh my, there's a YouTuber?
There's no news right now ㅜ
What did it say?
YouTubers are always an issue these days
Do you know about health shots?

Korean: 처음 들어봐 그냥 건강해지는 주사 아니야? 키키
English: First time hearing about it, isn't it just a health injection? Kiki

Korean: 이 사람이 건강 주사를 맞았는데 지금 부작용 나서 기사남
English: This guy got a health shot and now he's having side effects
okay?
How severe were the side effects?

Korean: 온 몸에 피멍이 장난 아니게 들었어,
English: I have a ton of bruises all over my body,
omg?

Korean: 그게 건강주사 그거 맞아서 그런 건가?
English: Is that because you got a health shot?

Korean: 엉 이게 부작용인 거 같은데 병원 태도때문에 더 이슈야
English: Yeah, I think this is a side effect, but it's more of an issue because of the hospital's attitude.
Why is the hospital's attitude like this?
You're not going to apologize, are you? Haha

Korean: 거기서는 환불규정부터 얘기했대 키키 사람이 이렇게 아픈데
English: They said they talked about the refund policy there, but Kiki is sick like this
Hospitals think more about money than health...

Korean: 그러니까 이 병원 어디인지 알고 싶다!
English: So I want to know where this hospital is!

Korean: 저긴 절대 안 갈거야 완전 상식 밖 행동이네
English: I would never go there. That's totally out of the ordinary.

Korean: 너 중국에서 유명한 그룹인 헝다라고 알아?
English: Do you know the famous Chinese group called Hengda?
Yeah, I've heard of the Hungda Group!

Korean: 그 그룹에서 진행하는 프로젝트는 뭔지 알고?
English: Do you know what projects that group is working on?
why?
Are you working on the project?
What is it, Kiki, I wonder
You said you were going to build an artificial island there!
omg?
Where are we going to build an artificial island?
As expected, it's a Chinese group

Korean: 그래서 너가 헝다그룹을 알고 있었을 걸?
English: So you knew about the Hungda Group?

Korean: 와 대박이네 인공섬을 만들 프로젝트를 세우다니...
English: Wow, that's amazing. They're setting up a project to build an artificial island...

Korean: 엉 맞아 근데 지금 이게 난리여,
English: Yeah, that's right, but this is a mess right now,
okay?
Why is there such a fuss about just making an artificial island?

Korean: 이제 미래를 위해서 투자를 한 건데 코로나 때문에 피해를 많이 봤대
English: Now, I invested for the future, but I suffered a lot of damage because of Corona.
I see. Corona is a problem everywhere these days...

Korean: 야 여기 부채만 얼마인 줄 알아?
English: Hey, do you know how much debt there is here?

Korean: 딱 봐도 엄청 많을 거 같아 키키
English: Just looking at it, it looks like there will be a lot Kiki

Korean: 엉 키키 354조래 조 단위 말이 되냐,
English: Hey Kiki, 354 trillion won, does that make sense?
Wow, why is the unit so high?
Is that possible
Where do you get your hair cut?
I went to the hair salon in my neighborhood and got my hair cut
Is that your regular beauty salon?

Korean: 응 키키 거기 디자이너가 나랑 친해
English: Yeah Kiki, the designer there is my friend
Oh, how many years have you been going?
I've been going there since I finished my first year of military service~

Korean: 거기가 마음에 들어서 계속 다니는 거야?
English: Do you keep going there because you like it there?

Korean: 그건 아닌데 서비스랑 가격이 착해 하하
English: No, but the service and price are good haha
Oh, how much does a men's haircut cost?
How about 12,000 won there?
It's cheap compared to the surrounding area Kiki

Korean: 근데 요즘 커트 가격 많이 올른 거 같지 않아?
English: But don't you think the price of hair cuts has gone up a lot these days?

Korean: 하긴 옛날에 난 5000원에 자르고 그러긴 했어
English: Well, back in the old days, I used to cut it for 5,000 won
Yes, I also had 5,000 won when I was in middle school.

Korean: 맞아 나도 그 때 그랬는데 지금은 기본 만원 단위야
English: Yeah, I did that back then, but now it's basically a ten-thousand won unit.

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 그래서 나 미용실 자주  안 가
English: Yeah ㅜㅜ That's why I don't go to the hair salon often

Korean: 그래도 지저분하니까 가야지 뭐 어쩌겠어 ㅠㅠ
English: But I have to go because it's dirty. What can I do? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 너 요즘에 먹는 약 같은 거 있어?
English: Are you taking any medication these days?
I'm taking rhinitis medicine these days because it's the changing of seasons

Korean: 너 비염 얼마나 심하길래 약까지 먹어!
English: Your rhinitis is so bad that you have to take medicine!
They say it's allergic rhinitis, but it seems more like chronic rhinitis...?
I see. So that can't be fixed?
They said there is no cure?
So I'm just going to hold out with medicine

Korean: 그렇구나 근처 병원가서 처방 받은 거?
English: I see. Did you get a prescription from a nearby hospital?

Korean: 아니 그냥 약국에서 나랑 맞는 약 샀지
English: No, I just went to the pharmacy and bought some medicine that was right for me.

Korean: 아 어떤 약 사는 거야 알약으로 사는 거?
English: Oh, what kind of medicine are you buying? Are you buying it in pill form?

Korean: 응 알약인데 나랑 잘 맞아 내성도 없고
English: Yeah, it's a pill, and it works well for me and I don't have any tolerance.
Oh really?

Korean: 비염약은 코에 직접 뿌리는 거 많이 나오던데?
English: There are a lot of nasal drops that you spray directly into your nose, right?

Korean: 아 그건 너무 강하고 코에 내성이 많이 생긴다더라 그건 패스!
English: Ah, that's too strong and builds up a lot of tolerance in the nose, so pass on that!
Oh really?

Korean: 그래서 지금 약 먹은 지는 얼마나 됐어?
English: So how long has it been since you took the medication?
It's been almost 2~3 years now...?

Korean: 헐, 너 군대 갔을 때는 안 힘들었어?
English: Wow, wasn't it hard when you went to the military?
At that time, I just held on with evil

Korean: 너 요즘에 자주 사용하는 어플 있어?
English: Are there any apps you use a lot these days?

Korean: 나 요즘엔 인스타그램, 페이스북밖에 안 해 키키
English: I only use Instagram and Facebook these days Kiki
What about things like shopping apps?

Korean: 나는 당연히 쿠팡 아니면 잘 안 써
English: Of course, I don't use anything other than Coupang

Korean: 너도 쿠팡맨이구나 키키 너도 그 정액권 샀어?
English: You're a Coupang Man too, Kiki. Did you buy that flat-rate coupon too?
Of course you mean Rocket WoW Membership?
That's right Kiki, people use that a lot!?
Yeah, that's really convenient and it only costs 2900 won per month.
Yeah, it's super cheap. Wasn't it all free shipping?

Korean: 그치 그리고 반품도 무료야 그래서 좋더라고~
English: Yeah, and returns are free too, so that's nice~
Oh really?
Free returns?
At that price!?
Is it a total blessing?
This is why I can't let go of Coupang
So I guess I should switch to Coupang too!
Come quickly, Coupang is a new world Kiki

Korean: 와 진짜 이래서 사람들이 쿠팡만 쓰는 구나!
English: Wow, this is really why people only use Coupang!

Korean: 응 나도 그 중 한 명이야~
English: Yeah, I'm one of them~
What music do you listen to these days?
I'm into ballads these days Kiki
Oh really?
Whose is it?
Have you seen ***'s new song that came out recently?
What was that guy's hit song?

Korean: *** 나 처음 들어보는데 그냥 노래가 좋아서 듣는 중!
English: *** This is my first time hearing this, but I'm listening to it because I like the song!

Korean: 그 사람 아마 목소리 진짜 좋은 사람일 걸!?
English: That person probably has a really nice voice!?

Korean: 오 맞아 키키 이름은 모르는데 목소리는 완전 좋아
English: Oh right, I don't know Kiki's name, but her voice is really good.
Kiki, isn't she a little husky?

Korean: 그래서 더욱 감미로운 노래가 가능한가 봐!
English: So I guess a sweeter song is possible!

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 나 *** 노래 완전 좋아함 ㅜ
English: Yeah ㅜㅜ I really like the song *** ㅜ

Korean: 너의모습이라는 제목인데 이거 지금 들어 봐 하하
English: The title is "Your Appearance", listen to it now haha

Korean: 키키 헐 제목만 봐도 좋아 보인다 들어봐야지!
English: Kiki, the title alone looks good, I have to listen to it!

Korean: 응 지금 바로 음악 앱 켜서 들어야 해
English: Yeah, I need to turn on the music app and listen to it right now.

Korean: 키키 오케이 나는 동영상으로 봐야지 실제로 부르는 거!
English: Kiki Okay I have to watch the video to see you actually singing it!

Korean: 그럼 유튜브에서 바로 실시간 라이브 검색해서 보면 딱이다~
English: Then, it would be perfect to search for it on YouTube and watch it live~

Korean: 너는 아직도 만화 같은 거 봐?
English: Do you still watch cartoons and stuff?
Yeah Kiki, I like comics~
Oh really?
What are you watching these days?
Have you ever heard of Comic Maple Story?

Korean: 너 아직도 메이플스토리 만화책 봄?  키키

English: It's already out, volume 100 is the last one, so I'm just going to keep reading!

Korean: 와오 그거 나 초딩 때부터 나왔던 건데

Korean: 키키 그러게 라떼가 한 5권 정도 나왔을 때 였을걸?
English: Kiki: That must have been when Latte Volume 5 came out, right?

Korean: 키키 그거 한 달에 한 번씩 출간됐을 걸?

Korean: 응 그래서 이미 완결 난 지 엄청 오래 지났어 하하

Korean: 그렇구나 키키 너 지금 몇 화까지 봄?

Oppa, are you having chicken jjigae for lunch today too?
Yeah Kiki of course
Today I ate chicken and beef stew
Hey, what's up with the beef today?
Of course, beef is also a lump of protein.
That's right Kiki
Do you eat beef often?
Ahn Kiki

Korean: 키키 헐 나는 소고기 와사비 얹어서 먹고 싶다!
English: Kiki Oh my gosh I want to eat beef with wasabi on top!

Korean: 아... 요즘 사람들 그렇게 먹길래 먹어봤는데 별로던데...
English: Ah... I tried it because people these days eat it like that, but it wasn't that good...
Oh really?

Korean: 흠 도대체 왜 맛있는 고기에 맛없는 와사비를 넣어 먹지?
English: Hmm, why on earth would you put tasteless wasabi on delicious meat?
Huh? No
Honey, have you ever tried Ichadol?
Huh? What is this secondary stone? This is my first time hearing about it.
This is a specialty restaurant for Ichadol Chadolbagi. So delicious!

Korean: 아 맨날 닭찌찌만 먹어서 그런지 외식을 잘 안 해서 몰랐네...
English: Ah, I didn't know because I only eat chicken stew all the time and I don't eat out much...

Korean: 그 차돌박이의 느끼함을 와사비가 잡아 줘!
English: Wasabi takes away the richness of the beef jerky!

Why wasabi?

Korean: 오빠네는 가전제품 다 개인적으로 산 것들이야?
English: Did you personally buy all of your home appliances?
no

Korean: 아직은 안 사고 옵션으로 있는 것만 쓰지?)
English: (I haven't bought it yet, so I'm just using the options that are available?)
Then, does your brother also go with the full option?
Yeah, usually you have to go with full options.

Korean: 그때마다 필요한 거는 좀 사 놓고 키키
English: Whenever I need something, I buy it and go to Kiki
Kiki, I see

That's right

Korean: 자가 살 거 아니면 풀옵션이 젤 좋은 거 같더라 키키
English: If you're not going to buy your own car, I think the fully-loaded option is the best. Kiki
that's right

Korean: 근데 나 궁금한 점 하나 있어!

Korean: 그러면 혹시 커텐이 고장 나면 이거 내가 고쳐줘야 해?

Korean: 음 커텐이 원래 옵션으로 있건 거야?
English: Um, were curtains originally an option?

But this was not cool from the beginning!

Korean: 처음부터 있는 거면 집주인한테 말해서 집주인이 고쳐줘야지 당연히
English: If it was there from the beginning, you should tell the landlord and he should fix it.

Korean: 그러면 나는 신경 쓸 게 없는 거지?
English: Then I don't have to worry about anything?
Yeah, that's right
The landlord will take care of it.
Oppa, is there a subway in Daegu?
Yeah of course Kiki
But it's a metropolitan city, so they ignore it! ㅡㅡㅋ
Oh, I don't care~
I asked because I didn't know~

Korean: 앜 키키 광역시 이런 데는 다 지하철 있지 않나?
English: Aren't there subways in places like Kiki's metropolitan area?
Is that so?
I don't know!

Korean: 음 지하철 있는 곳이 서울 경기도 대구 부산? 요 정도로 알고 있는데
English: Um, I think the places with subways are Seoul, Gyeonggi-do, Daegu, and Busan.

Korean: 논산은 시인데 지하철 안 생기겠지? 키키
English: Nonsan is a city, so there won't be a subway, right? Kiki
Yeah... I guess it won't happen?
It doesn't happen often in poetry
Oh my gosh, I see

Korean: 그리고 우리는 군부대도 있어서 땅 안 파겠지?
English: And we also have a military base, so we won't have to dig the ground, right?

Korean: 땅 파도 군인들이 다 파주지 않을까 키키
English: Kiki, won't the soldiers dig up the ground?
I don't even want to go to Nonsan

Korean: 키키 에혀 키키 그냥 나중에 차나 사야지~
English: Kiki ehye Kiki I guess I'll just buy a car later~
That's right

Korean: 차 사는 게 젤 편하고 좋지 키키
English: Buying a car is the most convenient and best Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 요즘에 신차 모닝이 얼마지?
English: Kiki, that's right. How much does a new Morning cost these days?

Korean: 음 옵션 다 넣으면 최대 2천정도 하지 않을까?
English: Well, if you add all the options, wouldn't it be around 2,000 at most?
Wow, it's a lot more expensive than I thought?

Korean: 음 그냥 이건 내 추측인 거고 한번 검색해봐 키키
English: Well this is just my guess, just search it up Kiki

Korean: 오빠가 했던 알바 중에 제일 고액 알바는 뭐였어?

Korean: 나 옛날에 고로쇠 하는 알바 했었는데 돈 짱 많이 줬어 키키

Oh my god, a goro?

Korean: 산타서 고로쇠 물통으로 빼면 끝이야 키키
English: If you take it out with a water jug from Santa Claus, it's over Kiki

Korean: 헐랭 키키 그것도 산을 타야 하는 구나?
English: Wow, Kiki. So you have to climb a mountain for that too?
Right Kiki
But it was really so hard I almost died

Korean: 헐 키키 그때 오빠가 몇 살이었어?

Korean: 그때 나 군대 가기 전이니깐 20살 정도?

Wow, you were a young and energetic person back then, was it hard?
Yeah, it's really hard

English: But I did it because they gave me a lot of money Kiki
Kiki, I see
How much was the daily wage at that time?
Well, at that time, they gave me 200,000 won a day, Kiki.

Korean: 헐 대박 그 고로쇠 물 받고 어떻게 내려왔어?

Korean: 그거는 주인 분이 무슨 물통 설치하셔서 그냥 산에서 그 통에 부으면 돼 키키
English: The owner installed a water tank, so you can just pour water from the mountain into it. Kiki

no

Korean: 헐 그러면 군대가 아니지 않나 키키

Just going camping and coming back?

Korean: 앜 키키 우리는 초코파이 하나면 영혼도 다 팔 수 있었지 키키

Kiki but there was also PX

right

Your monthly salary is 140,000 won, right?
Right Kiki
140 thousand won per month
Soldiers who don't even receive minimum wage...

Korean: 그러니깐 키키 그 정도면 전역하고 집도 사겠다 키키

If you were a native English speaking teacher, which country were you from?

Korean: 그렇구나 근데 어떻게 한국에 다시 오셨대?

Was that native English teacher a foreigner?

Korean: 오 신사적인 영국 사람 남자가 봐도 멋있지 키키

Korean: 와 진짜 그 쌤 때문에  영국 이미지가 확 좋아 보이더라!

Korean: 앜 키키 그러게 그럴 수도 있겠다

Korean: 키키 응 근데 우리가 너무 달라붙어서 부담스럽다고 떠남 키키
English: Kiki Yeah but we're too clingy so he leaves because it's burdensome Kiki
Wow, that was a bit too much
It's annoying if you stick too much, Kiki

Korean: 오빠는 주말에 어무니 보러 안 가?

Oh, are you going to see your parents?

no

Korean: 아 이왕 들리는 김에 밥이라도 한 끼 먹고 와 키키

I miss my parents

Korean: 그리고 11월 달에 한 번 또 가야 해!

Korean: 요즘에 도로가 잘 발달돼 있어서 생각보다 오래 안 걸려!

Korean: 오~ 키키 그러면 논산까지 기차 타고 가는 건가?
English: Oh~ Kiki, so are you taking the train to Nonsan?
no
I mostly use the bus!
Wow, isn't the bus incredibly uncomfortable?!
I can't even go to the bathroom on the way

Korean: 나는 화장실 자주 안 가서 괜찮아!
English: I don't go to the bathroom often, so it's okay!
Oh, that's good, Kiki

Korean: 버스타기 전에 아메리카노 먹으면 살짝 겁남 키키
English: I feel a little scared when I drink Americano before getting on the bus.

Korean: 키키 나는 멀미를 자주 해서 그냥 누워서 자!
English: Kiki I get motion sickness often so I just lie down and sleep!

Korean: 오홍 키키 그게 좋은 건지 안 좋은 건지 모르겠네 키키
English: Oh Hong Kiki I don't know if that's good or bad Kiki
Do you like daughters or sons?
Yeah, I'm definitely a son! Kiki
Kiki, really?
Nowadays, everyone wishes they had a daughter.

Korean: 응 요즘엔 다 딸이 좋다고 하던데 나는 딸 낳으면 좋은 아빠 못될 거 같애
English: Yeah, these days everyone says they like daughters, but I don't think I'd be a good father if I had a daughter.
Oh my, where did you hear that?
You can be a good father!

Korean: 딸 놓으면 통금 생기고 이럴까 봐 좀 그래
English: I'm a little worried that if I let my daughter go, there'll be a curfew or something like that.

Korean: 그냥 아들 놓고 맘 놓고 키우고 싶어 키키
English: Kiki, I just want to raise my son with peace of mind
Kiki, that's right, my daughter is like that

Korean: 근데 우리집 딸 둘인데 통금 따위 없음!
English: But we have two daughters and there's no curfew!

Korean: 옼 키키 부모님이 엄청 좋은 분이신가 봐 키키
English: Wow Kiki, your parents must be really nice people Kiki

Korean: 우리 집은 아들만 셋인데 다 통금 있었음 키키
English: There are only three sons in my house, and we all have curfews. Kiki

Korean: 헐  우리는 아빠가 어렸을 때부터 우리를 방목하듯이 키웠음 키키
English: Wow, we were raised like we were herds by our father since we were little Kiki

Korean: 나도 어릴 땐 그런 개방적인 부모님이 부러웠는데 키키
English: When I was young, I envied such open-minded parents. Kiki

Korean: 나 자취 시작한 것도 아빠가 몇 달 뒤에 알았음
English: My dad found out a few months later that I was living alone.
Oh my gosh Kiki that's a bit Kiki
Isn't there too little communication?
Kiki no

Korean: 말했는데 우리 아빠는 자기가 필요한 말 아니면 잘 안 들어
English: I told you, my dad doesn't really listen unless it's something he needs to hear.

Korean: 앜 키키 아버지 유쾌하시고 좋으신 분인가 봐 키키
English: Kiki, your father must be a cheerful and kind person. Kiki
Kiki no
Not like that haha

Korean: 그래도 나도 그런 부모님이었으면 좋긴 하겠다 키키
English: Still, I wish I had parents like that, Kiki
Didn't you say your brother was allergic to dog hair?
no
I don't have a dog hair allergy Kiki
Oh, you said you had a younger sibling?
Ahn Kiki
There is no one in my family Kiki
I guess I was thinking wrong~
What do you think about turtles as pets?
Wow turtle cake Kiki

Korean: 그거 나 초등학교 때 막 자라 키우고 그랬는데 키키
English: I was just growing up when I was in elementary school, and I was like Kiki
Oh really?

Korean: 자라는 근데 자연에서 데리고 온 거지?
English: It grows, but did you bring it from nature?
Ahn Kiki
Are you selling it?

Korean: 그래서 어항이랑 같이 사서 키우고 그랬지
English: So I bought it and raised it along with a fish tank.
Oh really?
Even if you grow up, don't you live a long life?

Korean: 응 키키 근데 초딩이라 뭘 알겠어
English: Yeah Kiki but I'm in elementary school so what would I know?
If you just raise them carelessly, they will die early...

Korean: 할 ㅜㅜ 나는 육지 거북 요즘에 눈에 밟히더라!
English: Wow ㅜㅜ I've been catching sight of land turtles lately!
Land turtle!?

Korean: 그래 요즘엔 뭐 이상한 거 다 키우더랔 키키
English: Yeah, these days, they're raising all sorts of weird things, Kiki
Yeah Kiki

Korean: 근데 육지 거북은 별로 내가 신경 쓸 게 없더라고!
English: But I don't really care about land turtles!
Um, Kiki, then wouldn't it be boring to raise them?
What if the purpose is to neglect?
no

Korean: 나는 그런 식으로 서로의 프라이버시를 존중할 수 있는 반려동물이 있었으면 좋겠음!
English: I wish I had a pet that could respect each other's privacy like that!

Korean: 아 그러면 고양이도 괜찮을 거 같은데 키키
English: Oh, then I guess the cat would be okay too Kiki

Korean: 오빠는 헬스 말고 다른 운동 해본 적 있어?
English: Have you ever done any other exercise besides working out?

English: Hello it's really nice to see you after such a long time. How have you been?

Korean: 이렇게 귀한 시간을 내주셔서 정말 감사드립니다. 덕분에 큰 도움이 되었습니다.
English: Thank you so much for taking the time to meet with me. Your help has been invaluable.

Korean: 제가 실수를 해서 불편을 끼쳐드린 것 같아 죄송한 마음입니다. 앞으로는 주의하도록 하겠습니다.
English: I feel truly sorry if I caused you any inconvenience with my mistake. I'll make sure to be more careful in the future.

Korean: 혹시 필요하신 게 있으면 언제든 말씀만 해주세요. 제가 도와드릴 수 있는 부분이 있다면 최대한 돕겠습니다.
English: If there’s anything you need please feel free to let me know anytime. I’ll gladly help in any way I can.

Korean: 요즘 바쁘실 텐데 건강은 괜찮으신지 궁금합니다. 무리하지 마시고 항상 몸 조심하세요.
English: I know you've been busy these days but I hope your health is well. Please take care and don't overwork yourself.

Korean: 말씀하신 내용을 듣고 정말 큰 감명을 받았습니다. 생각해볼 부분이 많아졌네요.
English: I was truly inspired by what you shared. It’s given me a lot to think about.

Korean: 식사는 하셨는지요? 아직 식사 전이시라면 제가 준비한 간단한 다과라도 함께 하시죠.
English: Have you had a meal yet? If not please feel free to join me for some refreshments I’ve prepared.

Korean: 최근에 하시는 일이 많으신 것 같아 걱정되네요. 힘들지는 않으신지 궁금합니다.
English: You seem to be handling a lot lately and I’m a bit concerned. I hope things aren’t too overwhelming for you.

Korean: 제가 설명이 부족했을 수도 있으니 혹시 이해가 어려운 부분이 있다면 언제든지 말씀해주세요.
English: My explanation might have been lacking so if there’s any part that’s unclear please don’t hesitate to ask.

Korean: 오늘 이렇게 시간을 내어주셔서 감사했고 조심히 돌아가셔서 편히 쉬시길 바랍니다.
English: Thank you for taking the time to meet today and please get home safely and rest well.

Korean: 요즘 날씨가 많이 추워졌는데, 감기 걸리지 않도록 따뜻하게 입고 다니세요.
English: The weather has gotten much colder these days, so please dress warmly to avoid catching a cold.

Korean: 지난번에 나눴던 이야기, 다시 한번 생각해봤는데 정말 좋은 의견이었던 것 같습니다.
English: I thought about the conversation we had last time, and I really think it was a great idea.

Korean: 제가 드린 설명이 충분하지 않았던 것 같습니다. 필요하시면 언제든지 다시 설명 드리겠습니다.
English: I feel my explanation may have been insufficient. Please let me know if you'd like me to explain again anytime.

Korean: 정말 오랜만에 뵙는 것 같아 반갑습니다. 변함없이 건강하신 모습 보니 기쁩니다.

Korean: 보육교직원 지원이십니까 혹시 지원이 어떤 지원이십니까
English: Are you applying for childcare support? What kind of support do you want?
That's our personnel expense support.

Korean: 네 선생님 원하시는 내용이 인건비 지원이십니까
English: Yes, sir, is what you want support for personnel expenses?
Yes, that's right. I called about labor cost support.
Are you requesting a connection to the same person?

Korean: 네 마지막에 통화한 담당자 분 연결 좀 해주세요
English: Yes, please connect me to the person you spoke with last time.

Korean: 저희 쪽에서는 저희가 처음 연결 해드린 담당자 분만 확인이 됩니다
English: On our side, only the person in charge we initially connected with can confirm.

Korean: 그러시면 저출산 고령화 대책과에서도 다른 분으로 연결을 할까요
English: In that case, should I connect you to someone else in the Low Birth Rate and Aging Society Countermeasures Team?

Korean: 네 제가 통화했던 분하고 통화 다시 하면 돼요
English: Yes, I can call back the person I spoke to.
Was the person you spoke to a man?

Korean: 아니요 여자분인데요 죄송한데 여기는 담당부서와 통화하려면요
English: No, I'm a woman. I'm sorry, but this is the department in charge.

Korean: 전화번호가 사이트 상에 안 나와있나요 담당과 전화번호가
English: The phone number is not listed on the site. The person in charge and the phone number are
If so, are you currently accessing the #@affiliation# homepage?

Korean: 네 #@소속# 내 #@소속# 홈페이지로 들어가야 되는 건가요
English: Yes, should I go to my #@affiliation# homepage?

Korean: 네 #@소속# 홈페이지를 접속하시면 경로를 안내 해드리겠습니다
English: Yes, if you access the #@affiliation# homepage, we will guide you through the path.

Korean: 그래요 그러면 아까 그 통화했던 잠깐 알려주시겠어요
English: Okay, then can you tell me briefly about the conversation we had earlier?
#@Affiliation# Have you accessed the homepage?
Wait a minute, where should I look?

Korean: #@소속#넷 글자 옆으로 정보 공개 소통 민원 소개 확인이 되십니까
English: #@Affiliation# Can you confirm the information disclosure, communication, and complaint introduction next to the four letters?
Yes, show me your #@affiliation# introduction
#@Affiliation# If you hover your mouse over the introduction
Yes, I put my mouse cursor there.

Korean: 초록색 첫 번째 줄 도청 안내부분 하단으로 전화번호 확인이 되십니까
English: Can you confirm the phone number at the bottom of the green first line wiretapping guidance section?
Yes, I see. I checked.
After clicking on the phone number
Then, the phone number will appear like this.
Yes, and what about the low birth rate and aging population policy that the teacher mentioned?
You must click on View Details under #@Affiliation#
Okay, I'll check it out and see what's more detailed.

Korean: 그리고 보육교직원 관련해서는 저출산고령화대책과를 클릭을 하신 후에요
English: And for childcare workers, click on the Low Birth Rate and Aging Society Countermeasures Department.

Korean: 하단으로 업무내용을 확인 해주시면 좋으실 듯 합니다
English: I think it would be better if you check the work content below.
Yes, that's what it looks like in terms of work.

Korean: 네 대표번호가 있는 부분이 아니고 담당자마다 번호가 있어서요
English: It's not that there's a representative number, but each person in charge has a number.

Korean: 저희 쪽에서 업무를 확인하는 부분입니다 불편을 드려서 정말 죄송합니다
English: This is a part of our work to check. We are truly sorry for any inconvenience.

Korean: 아까 제가 통화 했던 주무관님이랑 통화 하고 싶은데 연결 좀 해주시겠어요
English: I would like to speak to the officer I spoke to earlier. Could you please connect me?

Korean: 저희가 처음 연결해드린 담당자 분으로 연결을 하도록 하겠습니다
English: We will connect you to the person we first connected with.
Nice to meet you, I'm #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?

Korean: 예 제가 요양보호사라는 자격증을 신청할려고 하는데요
English: Yes, I'm planning to apply for a nursing assistant license.
Are you a new applicant for nursing care certification?
Yes, this is a new application.

Korean: 신규신청은 교육 받은 기관에서 일괄적으로 신청이 되고 있습니다
English: New applications are being submitted in bulk by the institutions that received training.
Is this something you applied for personally?

Korean: 네 신청하기로 한 날 제가 여행을 좀 장기로 가서요
English: Yes, I'm going on a long trip on the day I decided to apply.

Korean: 그러셨습니까 제가 확인 후 안내해 드리겠습니다
English: Is that so? I will check and let you know.
Could you please wait a moment?
Yes, I will wait for your confirmation.

Korean: 네 요양보호사 자격증 첫 교부 시에는 직접 방문 접수만 가능하십니다
English: Yes, when you first receive your nursing assistant certificate, you can only apply in person.
There is no other way than to visit in person.
Yes, sir, you can only register in person.
Okay, then I will apply next time I visit.
Yes, thank you. Have a nice day.
Thank you #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?
Yes, I am a part-time worker.
I'm curious about how annual leave is used.

Korean: 그러십니까 관련 부서가 서울 지방 고용 노동청인데요
English: Is that so? The relevant department is the Seoul Regional Employment and Labor Office.

Korean: 그래요 지금 통화가 어려워서 전화번호를 문자로 받을 수 있을까요
English: Okay, I'm having trouble getting through right now, so can I get your number via text message?

Korean: 네 가능합니다 전화하신 번호로 보내드리면 될까요
English: Yes, you can. Can I send it to the number you called?
Yes, please send it to this number
Okay, then I'll send you a text.
Thank you for your hard work in this hot weather.

Korean: 네 무더운 날씨 건강 조심 하세요 상담사 #@이름#이었습니다
English: Yes, please take care of your health in this hot weather. This was counselor #@name#
Yes, thank you. Thank you for your hard work.
Nice to meet you, I am #@Affiliation# #@Name# How may I help you?
Yes, I would like to report #@address#
Yes, is this the complaint you were experiencing at #@address#?

Korean: 당진시에서는 그거를 신고해도 자기는 상관이 없다고만 말씀하시거든요
English: In Dangjin City, even if you report it, they just say it has nothing to do with you.
Is the city saying it won't accept civil complaints right now?

Korean: 현재 업무시간이 지나 민원접수 담당자 연결이 지연되고 있습니다
English: It is currently outside of business hours and there is a delay in connecting with the person in charge of handling complaints.
Chungcheongnam-do doesn't normally accept civil complaints.

Korean: 민원 접수를 해주시면 해당 부서로 연결이 되고 있습니다
English: If you submit a complaint, you will be connected to the relevant department.

Korean: 해당부서를 당진시만 넘기고 충청남도에서는 민원을 안 받아요
English: The relevant department is only handed over to Dangjin City, and Chungcheongnam-do does not accept complaints.

Korean: 아까도 그래서 충청남도에다 한건데 당진시로 다 넘기시더라고요
English: That's why I did it in Chungcheongnam-do earlier, but they transferred it all to Dangjin-si.

Korean: 이전에 혹시 다른 번호로 저희 쪽에 전화 주신 이력 혹시 있으십니까
English: Have you ever called us from another number before?
Yes, you just passed it all to Dangjin City.

Korean: 제가 관광마케팅과에 상담 가능한 부서로 문자전송 해드린 부분이 있습니다
English: I have sent a text message to the tourism marketing department for consultation.
Teacher, do you have another number?

Korean: 애기 엄마들이 그때 번호가 또 있을지 모르겠는데 확인 좀 해보겠습니다
English: I'm not sure if the baby's moms have the number then, but I'll check.

Korean: 네 제가 #@소속# 관련 상담이 가능한지 연결 시도해보겠습니다
English: Yes, I will try to connect to see if I can consult about #@affiliation#
Yes, please do it once.
Teacher, I am truly sorry for the inconvenience.

Korean: 연결이 지연되어 오늘은 통화 어려울 듯 싶습니다
English: I'm afraid I won't be able to talk today due to a delay in connection.
Okay, I understand. Thank you for your hard work.
Hello, I am a counselor from #@Affiliation# Call Center #@Name#

Korean: 혹시 여사울에서 실리 성지까지가 오 점 육 킬로미터 거리라고 하는대요
English: By the way, I heard that the distance from Yeosuul to the Holy Land of Sili is about five and six kilometers.

Korean: 네 선생님 여사울에서 실리 성지 거리 말씀이십니까
